answers.answer: Ukrainian children can enroll in Romanian schools, kindergartens, or extracurricular activities. There are also options for Ukrainian online/part-time kindergartens, Ukrainian schools/classes, remote education, learning platforms, and free education in private schools.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: To enroll a child in school, contact the County Schools Inspectorates, fill out and submit the application with the audiences statute. The application will be analyzed within one day, and a Commission will contact you to decide on the child's assignment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in school'.

answers.answer: To enroll a child in extracurricular activities, contact the County Schools Inspectorates, fill out and submit the application without needing the audience statute. The application is analyzed within one day, and a Commission will contact you to decide on the child's assignment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in extracurricular activities'.

answers.answer: Children can benefit from psycho-pedagogical assistance and counseling by checking that option on the enrollment application form when enrolling in school or extracurricular activities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: For inquiries, Ukrainian students can contact Maricica Ciubara, the advisor for Ukrainian students at the Bucharest School Inspectorate (ISMB), at +40799626330 during working hours of 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Assistance in the integration of Ukrainian children into the Romanian education system'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian students can continue their university studies by going directly to the university of their choice. They can enroll based on a statement on their own responsibility regarding previous studies, even without documents, but each university has its own evaluation procedure.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Continuing your studies'.

answers.answer: To recognize or equate diplomas, you must contact CNRED (National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence) and submit a file with required documents. The file will be evaluated, and you will receive a response and your certificate.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I have completed my studies'.

answers.answer: For diploma recognition, typically required documents include an application (if submitted physically), a copy of the high school diploma/certificate, school situation for the last two years, a copy of personal identification documents, and an evaluation fee, unless exempt.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Steps you need to follow'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian minors under temporary protection are eligible for free accommodation in school dormitories, a daily food allowance, and additional financial support for school supplies, bedding, clothing, and footwear.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Accommodation and Allowances for Ukrainian Minors'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian children who want to learn Romanian can do so through the County School Inspectorates, which will create the necessary conditions and assure the appropriate human resources for the request.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Free courses and activities offered to refugees from Ukraine in Romania include language courses, yoga, drawing classes, chess, and music.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Courses and activities for refugees from Ukraine'.

answers.answer: Information regarding the structure of the school year and a list of days off in Romanian educational institutions can be found under the calendar of holidays.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Calendar of holidays in schools and kindergartens in Romania'.

answers.answer: Useful information is provided about Ukrainian online or part-time kindergartens and Ukrainian schools and classes available in different cities of Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Ukrainian schools and kindergartens in Romania'.

answers.answer: The diploma recognition process usually takes a maximum of 30 working days from the date a complete file is registered, though the deadline may be extended if further checks are required.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'What's next?'.

answers.answer: If original academic documents are not available for continuing studies, students may still enroll based on a statement on their own responsibility regarding previous studies, but each university has its own evaluation procedure.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Continuing your studies'.
